name: vis42
description: Connect Claude to your VIS42 account. Manage counterparts, products, invoices, payables, and query your business data via GraphQL.
long_description: VIS42 is an AI-first financial and revenue management platform, built on top of an agentic system; aim to automate your business administration and focus on what matters most, scale your business. VIS42 vision is to empower entrepreneurs and business owners with a reliable agentic system that will support them in their daily operations, allowing them to focus on growth and innovation. This extension connects Claude Desktop to your VIS42 account, letting you manage your business data through natural language. Create and update clients, suppliers, products, pricing, measure units, bank accounts, contacts, VAT IDs, and addresses — all without leaving Claude.

api_token.title: API Token
api_token.description: Your VIS42 API bearer token for authentication

tools.name: get-schema
tools.description: Return the complete GraphQL schema in JSON format of the VIS42 app.

tools.name: query
tools.description: Executes a GraphQL query.

tools.name: store-product
tools.description:
Create a new product or service.
The Product object represents the specific services, materials, or physical or digital goods sold.
A business must have at least one product configured in order to create any receivables.
Products can be of type "product" or "service", a product must have at least one default price.
When creating a new product or service, the price defined during creation is automatically set as the default price.
In the context of receivables, products are used to define line items, a measure unit is the standard unit used to
measure the quantity of a product or service.

tools.name: update-product
tools.description: Update an existing product or service.

tools.name: destroy-product
tools.description:
Delete an existing product or service.
A product can only be deleted if it is not associated with any receivables.

tools.name: store-product-price
tools.description:
Create a new price for a product or service.
A product can have only one price per currency.
A product must have at least one price, which is set as the default price.
Only one default price is allowed per product.

tools.name: update-product-price
tools.description: Update an existing price for a product or service.

tools.name: destroy-product-price
tools.description:
Delete an existing price for a product or service.
A price can only be deleted if it is not set as the default price for the product.
If the price to be deleted is the default price, another price must first be set as the default price.

tools.name: store-measure-unit
tools.description:
Create a new measure unit.
A measure unit can be associated with multiple products.
Examples of measure units: meters, kilograms, pieces, hours.

tools.name: update-measure-unit
tools.description: Update an existing measure unit.

tools.name: destroy-measure-unit
tools.description:
Delete an existing measure unit.
A measure unit can only be deleted if it is not associated with any products.

tools.name: store-counterpart-organization
tools.description:
Create a new counterpart (supplier or client).
Counterparts represent the suppliers and clients of a business.
A counterpart must be created before a business can create receivables and payables.
The counterpart's default address is normally used for invoicing and tax purposes, and referenced as billing address in invoices.
Depending on the counterpart’s country, it may have both tax and VAT IDs or only one of them. In some countries, the tax ID is the same as VAT ID.
A common compliance requirement for certain transaction types is to include the customer’s tax ID or VAT ID in invoices, if available. For example, intra-EU B2B sales require the customer’s VAT ID in invoices.
How to check if tax ID or VAT ID is required: require at least one of tax ID or VAT ID specified. If the counterpart is registered for VAT, we expect that the VAT ID is specified. If the counterpart is not VAT-registered, then tax ID is required.
What is a tax ID:
Also referred as Tax Identification Number (TIN), or Fiscal Code.
- Switzerland (CH):
    - The UID/IDI/IDE is the tax ID and also the VAT number., E.g., CHE-123.456.789 and CHE-123.456.789 IVA/TVA/MWST
- Italy (IT):
    - The Partita IVA is the tax ID and also the VAT number., E.g., 12345678901 and IT12345678901

tools.name: store-counterpart-individual
tools.description:
Create a new counterpart (supplier or client).
Counterparts represent the suppliers and clients of a business.
A counterpart must be created before a business can create receivables and payables.
The counterpart's default address is normally used for invoicing and tax purposes, and referenced as billing address in invoices.
Depending on the counterpart’s country, it may have both tax and VAT IDs or only one of them. In some countries, the tax ID is the same as VAT ID.
A common compliance requirement for certain transaction types is to include the customer’s tax ID or VAT ID in invoices, if available. For example, intra-EU B2B sales require the customer’s VAT ID in invoices.
How to check if tax ID or VAT ID is required: generally do not require a tax ID but may require a VAT ID.
What is a tax ID:
Also referred as Tax Identification Number (TIN), or Fiscal Code.
- Switzerland (CH):
    - The AVS/OASI number is the tax ID and VAT number defined as 756.XXXX.YYYY.ZZ = 10 numerals., E.g., 756.1234.5678.97
- Italy (IT):
    - The Codice Fiscale is the tax ID and VAT number defined as LLLLLL99L99L999L = 6 letters + 2 numerals + 1 letter + 2 numerals + 1 letter + 3 numerals + 1 letter., E.g., RSSMRA85M01H501U

tools.name: update-counterpart-organization
tools.description: Update an existing organization counterpart (business).

tools.name: destroy-counterpart
tools.description:
Delete an existing counterpart (supplier or client).
A counterpart can only be deleted if it is not associated with any receivables or payables.

tools.name: store-counterpart-bank-account
tools.description:
Create a new bank account for a counterpart.
Only one default bank account is allowed per counterpart.
A counterpart can have multiple bank accounts in different currencies.
Once a bank account is created in a specific currency, it CANNOT be changed to another currency.

tools.name: update-counterpart-bank-account
tools.description: Update an existing bank account for a counterpart.

tools.name: update-counterpart-individual
tools.description: Update an existing individual counterpart (person).

tools.name: destroy-counterpart-bank-account
tools.description: Delete an existing bank account for a counterpart.

tools.name: store-counterpart-contact
tools.description:
Create a new contact for a counterpart.
A counterpart can have multiple contacts.
Contacts are normally used when a counterpart is an organization, and the contacts are the individuals
working at that organization.

tools.name: update-counterpart-contact
tools.description: Update an existing contact for a counterpart.

tools.name: destroy-counterpart-contact
tools.description: Delete an existing contact for a counterpart.

tools.name: store-counterpart-vat-id
tools.description:
Create a new VAT ID for a counterpart.
A counterpart can have multiple VAT IDs.
A VAT ID (Value Added Tax Identification Number) is a unique government-issued identification number used for
tax purposes, specifically for value-added tax. It is assigned to counterparts and helps authorities track and
manage tax-related transactions.
Currently, VIS42 supports the following VAT ID types:
| Country              | Type         | Description                                                                                             | Example                |
| -------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------- |
| Australia            | `au_abn`     | Australian Business Number (AU ABN)                                                                     | *51824753556*          |
| Australia            | `au_arn`     | Australian Taxation Office Reference Number                                                             | *518247535567*         |
| Austria              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *ATU12345678*          |
| Belgium              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *BE0123456789*         |
| Brazil               | `br_cnpj`    | Brazilian CNPJ number                                                                                   | *28.271.211/0001-88*   |
| Brazil               | `br_cpf`     | Brazilian CPF number                                                                                    | *137.609.391-04*       |
| Bulgaria             | `bg_uic`     | Bulgaria Unified Identification Code                                                                    | *123456789*            |
| Bulgaria             | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *BG0123456789*         |
| Canada               | `ca_bn`      | Canadian BN                                                                                             | *123456789*            |
| Canada               | `ca_gst_hst` | Canadian GST/HST number                                                                                 | *123456789RT0002*      |
| Canada               | `ca_pst_bc`  | Canadian PST number (British Columbia)                                                                  | *PST-1234-5678*        |
| Canada               | `ca_pst_mb`  | Canadian PST number (Manitoba)                                                                          | *123456-7*             |
| Canada               | `ca_pst_sk`  | Canadian PST number (Saskatchewan)                                                                      | *1234567*              |
| Canada               | `ca_qst`     | Canadian QST number (Québec)                                                                            | *1234567890TQ1234*     |
| Chile                | `cl_tin`     | Chilean TIN                                                                                             | *12.345.678-K*         |
| Croatia              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *HR12345678912*        |
| Cyprus               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *CY12345678Z*          |
| Czech Republic       | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *CZ1234567890*         |
| Denmark              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *DK12345678*           |
| Estonia              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *EE123456789*          |
| European Union       | `eu_oss_vat` | European One Stop Shop VAT number for non-Union scheme                                                  | *EU123456789*          |
| Finland              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *FI12345678*           |
| France               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *FRAB123456789*        |
| Georgia              | `ge_vat`     | Georgian VAT                                                                                            | *123456789*            |
| Germany              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *DE123456789*          |
| Greece               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *EL123456789*          |
| Hong Kong            | `hk_br`      | Hong Kong BR number                                                                                     | *12345678*             |
| Hungary              | `hu_tin`     | Hungary tax number (adószám)                                                                            | *12345678-1-23*        |
| Hungary              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *HU12345678912*        |
| Iceland              | `is_vat`     | Icelandic VAT                                                                                           | *123456*               |
| India                | `in_gst`     | Indian GST number                                                                                       | *12ABCDE3456FGZH*      |
| Indonesia            | `id_npwp`    | Indonesian NPWP number                                                                                  | *12.345.678.9-012.345* |
| Ireland              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *IE1234567AB*          |
| Israel               | `il_vat`     | Israel VAT                                                                                              | *12345*                |
| Italy                | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *IT12345678912*        |
| Japan                | `jp_cn`      | Japanese Corporate Number (Hōjin Bangō)                                                                 | *1234567891234*        |
| Japan                | `jp_rn`      | Japanese Registered Foreign Businesses' Registration Number (Tōroku Kokugai Jigyōsha no Tōroku Bangō)   | *12345*                |
| Kenya                | `unknown`    | Kenya Revenue Authority Personal Identification Number (PIN)                                            | *P123456789X*          |
| Latvia               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *LV12345678912*        |
| Liechtenstein        | `li_uid`     | Liechtensteinian UID number                                                                             | *CHE123456789*         |
| Lithuania            | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *LT123456789123*       |
| Luxembourg           | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *LU12345678*           |
| Malaysia             | `my_frp`     | Malaysian FRP number                                                                                    | *12345678*             |
| Malaysia             | `my_itn`     | Malaysian ITN                                                                                           | *C 1234567890*         |
| Malaysia             | `my_sst`     | Malaysian SST number                                                                                    | *A12-3456-78912345*    |
| Malta                | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *MT12345678*           |
| Mexico               | `mx_rfc`     | Mexican RFC number                                                                                      | *ABC010203AB9*         |
| Netherlands          | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *NL123456789B12*       |
| New Zealand          | `nz_gst`     | New Zealand GST number                                                                                  | *123456789*            |
| Norway               | `no_vat`     | Norwegian VAT number                                                                                    | *123456789MVA*         |
| Pakistan             | `unknown`    | Pakistan National Tax Number (NTN) or Registration Number. Same value as the counterpart's `tax_id`.    | *4174941-3*            |
| Philippines          | `unknown`    | Philippines Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN), if it's registered for VAT.                           | *000123456001*         |
| Poland               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *PL1234567890*         |
| Portugal             | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *PT123456789*          |
| Romania              | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *RO1234567891*         |
| Russia               | `ru_inn`     | Russian INN                                                                                             | *1234567891*           |
| Russia               | `ru_kpp`     | Russian KPP                                                                                             | *123456789*            |
| Saudi Arabia         | `sa_vat`     | Saudi Arabia VAT                                                                                        | *123456789012345*      |
| Singapore            | `sg_gst`     | Singaporean GST                                                                                         | *M12345678X*           |
| Singapore            | `sg_uen`     | Singaporean UEN                                                                                         | *123456789F*           |
| Slovakia             | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *SK1234567891*         |
| Slovenia             | `si_tin`     | Slovenia tax number (davčna številka)                                                                   | *12345678*             |
| Slovenia             | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *SI12345678*           |
| South Africa         | `za_vat`     | South African VAT number                                                                                | *4123456789*           |
| South Korea          | `kr_brn`     | Korean BRN                                                                                              | *123-45-67890*         |
| Spain                | `es_cif`     | Spanish NIF number (previously Spanish CIF number)                                                      | *A12345678*            |
| Spain                | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *ESA1234567Z*          |
| Sweden               | `eu_vat`     | European VAT number                                                                                     | *SE123456789123*       |
| Switzerland          | `ch_vat`     | Switzerland VAT number                                                                                  | *CHE-123.456.789 MWST* |
| Taiwan               | `tw_vat`     | Taiwanese VAT                                                                                           | *12345678*             |
| Thailand             | `th_vat`     | Thai VAT                                                                                                | *1234567891234*        |
| Ukraine              | `ua_vat`     | Ukrainian VAT                                                                                           | *123456789*            |
| United Arab Emirates | `ae_trn`     | United Arab Emirates TRN                                                                                | *123456789012345*      |
| United Kingdom       | `gb_vat`     | United Kingdom VAT number                                                                               | *GB123456789*          |
| United Kingdom       | `eu_vat`     | Northern Ireland VAT number                                                                             | *XI123456789*          |
| United States        | `us_ein`     | Federal Tax Identification Number or EIN. Same value as the counterpart's `tax_id`.                     | *12-3456789*           |

tools.name: destroy-counterpart-vat-id
tools.description: Delete an existing VAT ID for a counterpart.

tools.name: store-counterpart-address
tools.description:
Create a new address for a counterpart.
Only one default address is allowed per counterpart.
A counterpart can have multiple addresses.

tools.name: update-counterpart-address
tools.description: Update an existing address for a counterpart.

tools.name: destroy-counterpart-address
tools.description: Delete an existing address for a counterpart.

tools.name: store-payable
tools.description:
Create a new payable. Payable are created with the status DRAFT.
Accounts payable refers to the money a business owes to its suppliers or vendors for products or
services that have been received but have yet to be paid for by the company.
Some of the document types used in accounts payable are:
- Payable - an invoice that the business receives from its supplier or vendor that lists the products or services
the company received and the amount due to the supplier or vendor.
- Purchase order - a document sent to a supplier or vendor detailing the products or services the company wishes to
purchase, including quantities and agreed-upon prices. [Not yet supported]
- Credit notes - reduces the amount due on a payable. [Not yet supported]
Each payable is allocated with a status that indicates its progress throughout the payable lifecycle, from its
creation until its payment.

tools.name: update-payable
tools.description:
Update an existing payable. Only DRAFT payables can be updated.
Accounts payable refers to the money a business owes to its suppliers or vendors for products or
services that have been received but have yet to be paid for by the company.

tools.name: destroy-payable
tools.description:
Delete an existing payable.
A payable can ONLY be deleted when it is in a DRAFT state.

tools.name: mark-as-new-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **New**.
    A payable can only be set to **NEW** when it is in a DRAFT or REFUSED state.

tools.name: approval-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **Approval Pending**.
    A payable can only be set to **APPROVAL PENDING** when it is in a NEW state.
    When a payable is being set to **APPROVAL PENDING**, an approval request is sent to the approver.

tools.name: approve-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **Approved**.
A payable can only be set to **APPROVED** when it is in an APPROVAL PENDING state.
When a payable is being set to **APPROVED**, it means that the approver has reviewed and approved the payable for payment.

tools.name: refuse-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **Refused**.
A payable can only be set to **REFUSED** when it is in an APPROVAL PENDING state.
When a payable is being set to **REFUSED**, it means that the approver has reviewed and rejected the payable.

tools.name: cancel-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **Cancelled**.
A payable can only be set to **CANCELLED** when it is in an NEW state.

tools.name: mark-as-paid-payable
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing payable to **Paid**.
    A payable can only be set to **PAID** when it is in a APPROVED state.

tools.name: store-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Create a new receivable invoice. Receivables are created with the status DRAFT.
Accounts receivable refers to the money owed to a business by its clients for products or
services that have been delivered but have yet to be paid for by the clients.
An invoice is a request for payment that lists the products or services the business delivered and the amount due.
Each receivable is allocated with a status that indicates its progress throughout the receivable lifecycle,
from its creation until its payment.
Once the receivable invoice is finalized and ISSUED to the counterpart, it cannot be modified. In case changes
are needed, a credit note must be ISSUED to correct the original receivable invoice, and if necessary, a new receivable invoice can be created.
A credit note reduces the amount due on an issued receivable invoice.
Prerequisites
To be able to create and issue receivables invoice, a business must have at least:
- A counterpart: a receivable needs to specify counterpart, which can be an individual or a organization. The counterpart must have at least one billing address.
- A product or service: a receivable needs to specify at least one line item that specifies the products or services provided to the counterpart.
- A VAT ID: a receivable needs to specify the VAT ID of the business.
- A bank account: a receivable also needs to specify the business bank account to which the payment should be made. This bank account must be able to accept the currency reflected on the receivable.
- A payment term: a receivable also needs to specify the business payment terms, that define the period within which the payment for the receivable must be made.

tools.name: store-receivable-quote
tools.description:
Create a new receivable quote. Receivables are created with the status DRAFT.
Accounts receivable refers to the money owed to a business by its clients for products or
services that have been delivered but have yet to be paid for by the clients.
Some of the document types used in accounts receivable are:
Each receivable is allocated with a status that indicates its progress throughout the receivable lifecycle,
from its creation until its payment.
Prerequisites
To be able to create and issue receivables quote and invoice, a business must have at least:
- A counterpart: a receivable needs to specify counterpart, which can be an individual or a organization. The counterpart must have at least one billing address.
- A product or service: a receivable needs to specify at least one line item that specifies the products or services provided to the counterpart.
- A VAT ID: a receivable needs to specify the VAT ID of the business.

tools.name: update-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Update an existing receivable invoice. Invoices can only be updated when they are in DRAFT status.
Accounts receivable refers to the money owed to a business by its clients for products or
services that have been delivered but have yet to be paid for by the clients.
An invoice is a request for payment that lists the products or services the business delivered and the amount due.
Each receivable is allocated with a status that indicates its progress throughout the receivable lifecycle,
from its creation until its payment.
Once the receivable invoice is finalized and ISSUED to the counterpart, it cannot be modified. In case changes
are needed, a credit note must be ISSUED to correct the original receivable invoice, and if necessary, a new receivable invoice can be created.
A credit note reduces the amount due on an issued receivable invoice.

tools.name: update-receivable-quote
tools.description:
Update an existing receivable quote. Quotes can only be updated when they are in DRAFT status.
Accounts receivable refers to the money owed to a business by its clients for products or
services that have been delivered but have yet to be paid for by the clients.
A quote is a formal offer that details how much the products or services will cost before the client commits to a purchase.
Each receivable is allocated with a status that indicates its progress throughout the receivable lifecycle,
from its creation until its payment.
Prerequisites
To be able to create and issue receivables quote and invoice, a business must have at least:
- A counterpart: a receivable needs to specify counterpart, which can be an individual or a organization. The counterpart must have at least one billing address.
- A product or service: a receivable needs to specify at least one line item that specifies the products or services provided to the counterpart.
- A VAT ID: a receivable needs to specify the VAT ID of the business.

tools.name: destroy-receivable
tools.description:
Delete an existing receivable.
A receivable can only be deleted if it is in a DRAFT state.

tools.name: issue-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable invoice to **Issued**.
A receivable can only be set to **ISSUED** when it is in an DRAFT state.
When a receivable is being set to **ISSUED**, it means that the receivable has been issued to the customer.

tools.name: issue-receivable-quote
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable quote to **Issued**.
A receivable can only be set to **ISSUED** when it is in an DRAFT state.
When a receivable is being set to **ISSUED**, it means that the receivable has been issued to the customer.

tools.name: cancel-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable to **Cancelled**.
A receivable can only be set to **CANCELLED** when it is in an **ISSUED** or **OVERDUE** state.
When a receivable is being set to **CANCELLED**, it means that the receivable is no longer valid and will not be collected.

tools.name: mark-as-paid-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable invoice to **Paid**.
A receivable can only be set to **PAID** when it is in an ISSUED, OVERDUE, or PARTIALLY_PAID state.
When a receivable is being set to **PAID**, it means that the receivable has been fully paid by the counterparty.

tools.name: mark-as-partially-paid-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable invoice to **Partially Paid**.
A receivable can only be set to **PARTIALLY PAID** when it is in an ISSUED, OVERDUE, or PARTIALLY_PAID state.
When a receivable is being set to **PARTIALLY PAID**, it means that the receivable has been partially paid by the counterparty.

tools.name: mark-as-uncollectible-receivable-invoice
tools.description:
Set the status of an existing receivable invoice to **Uncollectible**.
A receivable can only be set to **UNCOLLECTIBLE** when it is in an ISSUED or OVERDUE state.
When a receivable is being set to **UNCOLLECTIBLE**, it means that the receivable has been partially paid by the counterparty.
